column4: Been here 150 times. Honest. Over 30 years. Service and food is always consistent. Fine cocktails and wine. Excellent service. Moved away but always visit them
This was by far the best prime rib I‚Äôve ever had! Be sure to make reservations well in advance, this place is crazy busy.
Good, not great prime rib! Definite tourist attraction. Over priced, and average meat. Other chain steak houses have equal or better quality for half the price.

Referred by our friends to try their great prime rib! So good, great environment , amazing service. They carve the prime rib right in front of you served table side. Nice touch. Overall a great experience I would totally come back

Classic, old school prime rib joint. Basic menu prime rib, salad choice of potato and Yorkshire pudding. Get the king cut and have it seared. Waiter was great. Prime rib was excellent. When I was finished they offered me another piece. Lol. Loved it.
Celebrated our anniversary here. The food and service were excellent and they did everything possible to make it a special night.

We went for our 10th wedding anniversary. The atmosphere is superb and the place is absolutely rammed. The food is sensational and we recommend the prime rib, larger the better üòÅ You would be insane if you don't visit on any visits to San Francisco!
The prime rib was very good, but the rest of the meal was excellent. Our server, Mitra, was delightful and very attentive! My shout out for the creamed spinach - it was A-MA-ZING.
This it's a great place to go for dinner really good portion of meat everything included on the price salad cream of spinach mashed potatoes o baked potatoes

We have been going to House of Prime Rib for decades. Excellent value, although through the years, it can be very hard to get reservations. Is noisy and very hard to have an intimate dinner. Love the salad and the cart.
The service is excellent! Food is delicious!!! Everything I wanted plus more!! The drinks were good and the food and service is amazing!!!
Delicious prime rib celebration with family of 10. Wonderful, attentive waiter. Just what I hoped for.

We are Asians, small appetite but the staff happily allowed sharing and made us feel so welcome. Steak was full of flavour, very tender, price very affordable, environment though very busy was cosy and there were happy faces all round.
What can I say: If love prime rib like we do, this place is fantastic! But, if you go, be sure everyone wants that, or they will be out of luck!

Prime Rib was amazing and the service stellar. It is very loud inside of the restaurant due to it's popularity. We all commented we wish we didn't feel rushed to eat and get out. Otherwise, I highly recommend this restaurant

column3: Do not go here they trick you with 3 hour wait
column4: You arrive they tell you it‚Äôs 1‚Äì1.1/2 hours and really it‚Äôs 3 hours Service is so rude and they are deceptive about the queues The are booked 5-9.30pm Then you wait and wait and wait and then you ar seated 9.45

I am sold!!!! I am coming back next visit. Great prime rib like I remember from years gone by. Yorkshire pudding, tender meat, mashed potato and gravy were amazing. I loved the salad, and bread. Our waitress and help were excellent.
Reserved a table, arrived 10 min early, waited for 45 minutes to be seated... did not yet get a chance to rate the food. Do not get the ‚ÄúOld fashioned‚Äù or the Martini. They are terrible :(

column3: The highest quality and the best Prime Rib I‚Äôve ever had in my life! Salad and side dishes couldn‚Äôt have been better. Th
column4: The highest quality and the best Prime Rib I‚Äôve ever had in my life! Salad and side dishes couldn‚Äôt have been better. The best service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Don‚Äôt mess around with anything but the thickest cut of prime rib. Ask for the tobacco horseradish. Spinach and baked potato are my favorite Fantasy Cake for desert Kelly is a great waitress and really takes care of her guests.

This is a traditional restaurant in San Francisco. We always recommend it to friends and family, but our last time dinner the prime rib house cut and the end cut petite was not us expected. Very tough.

column3: SO SO SO SO AMAZING - Must Visit
column4: It has been a while since I found an amazing restaurant that knows prime rib. You can't do better than House of Prime Rib and the whole atmosphere goes right along with the food.

Best Prime Rib...I had the gigantic portion...the Martini‚Äôs are amazing also...not a fan of creamed anything but the dinner was amazing! Get a rez bcuz you may not eat or be waiting for hours if you don‚Äôt. Worth it tho!!
I was here for dinner tonight with my sister and brother-in-law. I‚Äôm not a huge Prime Rib fan so I had their Chilean Sea Bass. It was delicious!

I have been eating at House of Prime Rib for years and always look forward to this place every time I travel to San Francisco. This is an old school quaint essential San Francisco establishment. The service is impeccable and the food is wonderful.

column3: Sorry guys.. I just don‚Äôt get it
column4: I‚Äôm sure this could done a whole lot better.. Perhaps it was just an off day for me but I wasn‚Äôt feeling everyone else‚Äôs experience here.. the beef at Huntsman in Dunchurch is far better... Sorry again but won‚Äôt give it a second try
Sat at the bar and received fast and friendly service. Prime rib is excellent and comes with plentiful sides. Great overall experience.
We had an amazing dinner in that place. Everything was great. The service was really friendly and the meal was lovely!

You walk in the you feel like you just went back to 1955. The drinks are ok, I had a watered down Manhatten. The food is great and the so is the staff. It's expensive but you will walk out of there VERY ful
This is absolutely the best prime beef I have ever tasted. It a a complete ceremony around prime beef, and they really know how to do so. Love this place.

A great place for a prime rib dinner. If you‚Äôre on your own - eat at the bar. Very good service. Suggest going for +1 on your ‚Äòhow do you like that cooked‚Äô as my medium came out quite rare. All good.
The meat here is very good and you get very big portions but I have had better. We were served quickly despite the place being so busy that there was a 2 hour wait to eat at the bar.
Very good restaurant. The meat is incredible. Almost imposible to eat everything. The bread is fantastic. Also very good service.
if you want to taste a good steak, this would be one of good choices. But a problem is you should make a reservation at least before a month you visit there
To much to big wow proper nice steak place this a little pricey but you come off street thinking its dead and its buzzing great place for special occasion
Having dined here a number of times and this last time was the last. Portions are smaller and the plates they are served on are smaller while the price climbs. Not worth the effort.

When you plan to go to a high-end steakhouse, this is what you expect. The service, the food, the simple menu. We were very impressed with this establishment. I can't wait for the next special occasion!
We had dinner here on Aug 11, we had to wait almost an hour but I can say that it deserves it. I had the house classical cut and was delicious and generous.
Very good meal, somewhat expensive. They even offered me a second slic of beef after i had finished..reservations highly suggested. We arrived without one but they seated us in about 45 minutes
A great place, outstanding meat, juicy and super delicious. A huge waiting list because the house is very famous. Service good a bit overdone...too busy The only bad point: it is so loud!
Four people for a business dinner. The food and service were top notch. It was not conducive for actually conducting business but great for entertaining customers!

column3: If you love steak! This is the place!
column4: It is very good, but my advice is booking in advance because it is very popular, very difficult for a walk-in! Menu is very simple 5 deferents size of steak and you choose or the sides! Quality is good!

column3: Could be the best meal of my life
column4: There are no words for how delicious this meal was. The mashed potatoes were creamy, the meat tender and cooked to perfection, the Yorkshire pudding soaked up all the yummy gravy....the inside was lovely and old school. The entire experience was wonderful. Just go!!!!
Really enjoyed the food. It was VERY filling so don't be an amateur and eat too much bread at the start. Service was great and the chef was accommodating to a last minute change.
Heard so much about this place, but it was ok and no more. The steak was very tender which is great, but lack of flavor.. also the desserts (crem brule & bread pudding). Not worth the money.

Obviously this is a well known establishment in San Francisco. My wife saw it on TV one time and we always wanted to go. Finally got a chance this last month. Fantastic food and experience. I would go back.

column3: Best roast beef I have tasted
column4: The best roast beef I have had in a long time and amazing salad that is prepared at your table, excellent mashed potatoes and baked potatoes with amazing fillings. I will be back here again.
The restaurant is wonderful . Tasty is very good. Steaks are delicious and salads are also amazing . I really enjoy it. The staffs are very friendly and nice.
Expect 2-3+ hours wait if don't have reservations. People willing to wait that long to have Prime Rib, that's all I need to say.
The old school ambiance and menu work really well here. The food is absolutely amazing. I see why it‚Äôs difficult to get a reservation. HOPR: don‚Äôt change a thing.

column3: I normally don‚Äôt like prime rib but
column4: This place was awesome! It was quite the experience and super delicious. It‚Äôs a lot of food that you get for your money‚Äôs worth.

column3: great and classic dinner in the city
column4: been many times but no since moving to Denver great dinner, service and the whole ball of wax..a SF must go
Terrific prime rib perfectly cooked. Good service. Reasonable cost for the area. We'll go back next time we're in the city.

The food is excellent and the atmosphere is very lush and sophisticated. Somehow the waiter seemed to have added and additional $20 to our bill (on top of what we tipped!) and that has not yet been resolved.

We visited for a friend‚Äôs birthday for a special occasion. It was only a choice of which type of cut of beef you wanted but the wait was worthwhile - an amazing meal with amazing service. Highly recommended for anyone nearby!
We expected fine dining.What we got was average food with a bunch of kids in t shirts and shorts.Noisy and obnoxious.So glad we didn‚Äôt bring quests we would have been so embarrassed.

column3: Best Prime Rib Ever! (Not for vegetarians)
column4: You definitely need a reservation if you want to eat at a decent time. The prime rib was amazing and I don't even like prime rib! The sour dough bread is also delicious! All the sides are great and highly recommend the horseradish sauce.

Hands down, THE BEST prime rib! The food and service were impeccable! Go there hungry because the servings are plentiful. And the table-side service was a treat. Definitely on the list for our next trip to SF.

Very busy bustling place full of energy that has Great food, Great service. The only negative is that they ran out of red wine glasses last night and we drank a great wine in Chardonnay glasses. The best prime rib I have every had !

column3: The name says all, but I'll say, "Its awesome!"
column4: Classy yet relaxing atmosphere, professional and friendly staff, cold drinks...and of course the fabulous PRIME RIB (and other great grub)! My wife and I both enjoyed this, though I may have eaten a bit more than she did. ;) ENJOY!

The food was excellent! More important was the customer service. The people were very welcoming and enjoyable. Make reservations is better than dropping in but if you do drop in do it early. Better chance of eating early
Don't ever miss prime ribs here if you are meat lover, visiting SF. The queue is worth waiting for, our queue is 1hr waited but eventually only took us 30mins waited. I definitely visit again!!

When my wife and I get that urge for prime rib, we head to House of Prime Rib, the best. The salad, baked potato, and spinach adders top it off. GM Evan Burns does a great job as he done for over 10 years.
Had a great meal here food was first class and good service , friendly service and the steak was to die for well worth booking

House of Prime Rib has the best prime rib anywhere. I compare every prime rib meal and no others measure up. You have to plan ahead and get a reservation but they will take some walk-ins but you need to go early.

column3: Fantastic prime rob cooked to perfection!
column4: Had dinner with our daughter and her boyfriend here. The food and service were amazing! Reservations book up quickly so plan ahead!
They squeeze you like sardines! The tables are so packed together that one can hardly walk between them. The quality of the prime rib is just so so. It a very mass production show.
This Restaurant servers are great,,, ALWAYS lots of customers ... Very good Baked potatoes and cream of Spinach.

This restaurant serves various cuts of prime rib with excellent sides. Between the salad, potato, and creamed spinach, you will not walk out hungry! Not a prime rib person, but this was great. Nice atmosphere with top of the line service.
This place is great, I have been here many times. Mainly cos they serve and amazing Roast beef, with a delicious side of baked potatoes. Pure comfort food cooked to perfection.

Fantastic no other words necessary other than the Yorkshire puds! Chef don't open the oven while they're cooking otherwise they go flat like ours! Other than that just brilliant. Worth the trip to SFO.

column3: We ate like a famine was coming tomorrow ...
column4: The absolute best prime rib in town!!! Great people , exceptional service , it's hard to beat that package ! We came here hungry and left stuffed and satisfied!
.....who could ask for anything more 'ONE MENU CHOICE' its prime rib all the time and I don't mind at all. I can truly say that this was one of my favorite restaurants of all times.
great food large cuts of prime rib with baked potato or mashed. Yorkshire pudding and spinach as sides... almost forgot about the salad!
We were very close to the next couple. It was so loud that it was difficult to carry on a conversation. Food was better than average, but not worth the price.

Location: Nob Hill Parking: metered, paid street parking Atmosphere: traditional, warm, elegant Staff: incredibly accommodating Menu: limited to a fairly fixed menu Drinks: standard Meal: unbelievable - try it Prices: pricy Visit Again: please! Recommend To Friends: you bet

column3: Loud restaurant with lots of food
column4: Very loud, touristic restaurant with lots of big tables and long lines. Good meat and sauce but not worth the price. Expensive but dishes are big even for US standards
A n old standby that still delivers a lot of meat for your dollar. Old time service and tasty sides like creamed spinach
Arrived from the UK and this was the first restaurant we eat in top notch food and service and you will not find a better steak anywhere else an absolute must to visit.
An excellent place for Prime Rib. Ate at the bar with 2 other family members. It was worth the wait. Delicious food and great service, once seated.

column3: Get reservations for the prime rib of your life!
column4: I've been to lots of different steakhouses and this rivals them all for the best of the best! Everything you order here is high quality and prepared perfectly! If you have the chance, do not miss it!
They do Prime Rib right as the name describes. Finish your house cut and get another slice. Accompanied by salad, creamed spinach, bread, sometimes cornbread. For around $50, it's a deal!
Have wanted to try this for a few years but not got around to it before now. Service, surrounding all 5 starts and the food deserves 6 stars !!
The food was amazing, and great service. Definitely recommend this place. The price was good for the great meal you get.
The service was excellent. The prime rib was cooked to perfection. The dinner comes with salad, cream spinach potatoes, Yorkshire pudding. You will be taking a doggie bag home. You need reservations.
Great Service. Great food. The menu is carnivore's perfection. The service had a personal touch. If you're in this area I recommend it
The House of Prime Rib has the best Prime Rib. Served table side and with all the side dishes. A great piece of San Francisco history.
I don't normally choose Prime Rib, but this it place to make an exception. The meat is perfect, with all the Au jus you want. It's a once in a lifetime meal.
This place has one of the prime ribs! Good service, although reservations are hard to get because of their popularity, it is well worth the wait! Love ‚ù§Ô∏è this resto!
Terrific restaurant for having only one dish but with 3 choices on how to have it cut. Keep your expectations up because flavoursare unique. The only comment I would do is that they don't have wifi.
Loved it the food was excellent. The wait time was 2 minutes. I prime rib was tender and juicy, the mashed potato and cream spinach was delicious. Would differently go back
Great service, prime rib cooked and cut to order, price for prime rib includes sides. Dining experience comfortable and not rushed. Friends highly recommend this restaurant

It was our first time and we were so impressed with the service and the quality and taste of everything specially the Prime Rib. It melts in your mouth. I have never had anything like this. We will definitely come back. Great job!!'

We had dinner with our family and close friends. The service was excellent and the food absolutely delicious! The prime rib is perfect accompanied by salad, potato, Yorkshire pudding and spinach. I highly recommend dining here. It is an experience not to be missed!
It has been a few years since I ate and when I did it was very good and I enjoyed the prime rib I would totally recommend this place to anybody

To say they feed you is an understatement. Standard meal gives you enough for 2 days for an average size guy. Prime ribs are large and prepped right at your table. Not to mention the nice size portioned sides. Two thumbs up on the meal.
Delicious food! It was very loud though and difficult to have conversation. Make a reservation and bring your appetite. We will eat here again!
Perfect meat, tender and juicy. You must order medium or well done, if you don't want to eat it very red. The side orders are very yummy. The mashed potatoes are delicious.

Even after all these years, their roast beef is still roasted and cut to perfection, exactly to what you requested. The side dishes are large and well prepared. You always come away very satisfied and too full, and happy with the bill.

This is how prime rib should be served! Prepared in rock salt and served tableside! Portions are generous, servers are attentive! It's all in the presentation! You'll certainly enjoy this absolutely phenomenal dining experience!
You have never had prime rib like this. Cut off the whole rib table side, it is the juiciest you ever ate. The spinach, corn, and salad are all included. Great value for a great meal.
Excellent service and great prime rib. Simple menu is welcomed, you know you are having prime rib. I enjoyed the salad made at your table.

column3: The only place for Prime Rib
column4: Best Prime Rib place in the Bay Area, maybe even in the USA. Always superb in taste and tenderness. Outstanding and friendly service.

column3: A wait, delicious food and no lingering
column4: Either call ahead or be prepared for about 45-60 min wait. The food is delicious with huge portions and moderately priced. If you enjoy a lovely grilled piece of prime rib... Stop! Look no further... It's here.
This was the high light of my San Fran eating experience. The meat selection is outstanding, and the quality is superb. I highly recommend treating yourself to this spot.

column3: Best restaurant we have been - fantastic prime rib
column4: Didn't really know what to expect but the reviews were so good thought we'd try. Absolutely awesome. Specialise in the prime rib and do it brilliantly! A bit pricey but worth every penny. Great staff, a bit of theatricals when making up the salad at...More

It is usually hard to give out five stars for anything, let alone someplace that can be a bit expensive and where you may not even expect value. However, The House of Prime Rib not only blew away every expectation that I had, but I happily paid the bill because this just was one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. Mind you I have been at some of the best steakhouses in New York, Chicago, had prime rib at the Original Lawry's in Beverly Hills, great meat when I lived in Texas, but The House of Prime Rib tops them all!  I say it is the best I have ever had as everything was fantastic! I went with my wife, daughter and cousins and just had a blast! My wife and daughter love prime rib and really do know what is good and is not. I knew we had a great meal when my wife made sure to let me know how good it really was.  I have to say everything started on the right foot when The House of Prime Rib allowed me to expand our reservation from 3 people to 7 just 24 hours before we arrived. My cousin found out that we were going there and made arrangements to bring his family from an hour away to join us! He had always wanted to go, so off we went!  Now mind you, this is not a cheap place, but when we finished I had to let the desk know that the meal I had was not only one of the best I (WE) had ever had, but I had no problem paying the $150 bill for the three of us since it was such value. Yes, value at a fancy, high end place! Oh, and with out all the snootiness you sometimes find at these places. Quite the opposite as everyone was super nice, accommodating and had one of the widest ranges of clientele that I have seen.  As for the food.... Everything was just wonderful! Our server and her assistants were terrific, very helpful when ordering, and always explained what was being served or answered any question we had. I was a bit taken aback when we received our salad as it was huge!  The prime rib was to die for! Wow, you could nearly use a fork to cut it since it was so tender. The creamed spinach had some kind of spice that put a bite on it, but it was really great none-the-less. If you like baked potatoes, go here! Dang the thing was huge! Interestingly enough, one of my cousins kids does not eat meat, but she was taken care of really well also as they had a beautiful King salmon for her. Her family was sharing it and it was just as good as everything else!  Bottom line is that this was a great place, albeit on the high side, but well worth it! Just make sure to make reservations! Can't wait to get back to San Francisco just to go back to dinner here!

Ok...so obviously, you have to like prime rib if you're going to eat here. And if you do...this will be up there with the best you've ever had! It's super old school and the wait is long, but worth it...we grabbed a drink in the lounge area while we waited and wound up sitting at the bar, which I personally prefer. The drinks were great, the service was great and the food was even better! I can't say it enough...GO EAT HERE!!

column3: OF COURSE, WORLD CLASS PRIME BEEF, NEXT TIME, GIVE ME A LITTLE MORE LEISURE
column4: Obviously, prime is their beef. The Henry VIII cut guarantees that if you still need more beef, they will continue to slice beef for you till you pass out, so if your favorite grandchild plays rt tackle for Stanford, this is his dish. Their sides are excellent, espec the creamed spinach, baked potato is enormous No need to upgrade to a larger cut of prime rib and the regular cut is fine:P I did a bit of an upgrade at the suggestion of the waiter(+ $3.00) for an item where they thin slice three pieces of prime rib, his suggestion being that some folks find the flavor of the thin cut is better than that of the full cut: after the meal, I agreed and recommend this alternative. My only criticism is that I felt we were ever so gently rushed, especially when we ordered our cocktails we asked for time before the salad course(included in the price of the dinner) was served: we were only half way through our cocktails when the salad was served, but of course I suppose this is a restaurant where one eats and does not dine: though they are not lacking in business, for me, this will be my first and last time at the restaurant, and they can defend their policy by pointing to the crowds at the door when the place opened its door that night.

This was our second time we went to The House of Prime Rib. Like our previous visits, the meal tasted great. The menu isn't extensive but this made it easier for us to choose. I had the city cut prime rib dinner, while my boyfriend had the English cut. Both of our meals tasted great. When we ordered, I thought that the meal just came with a baked potato, which can be cooked other ways, and a choice of one of two vegetables. The meal also comes with sourdough bread to start, salad before the main, and freshly made Yorkshire pudding with the prime rib. As with many of the customers, we ended up taking the leftovers home. I also enjoyed the seasoning so much, I bought two bottles to take home! The ambiance is louder than usual and my only complaint is we felt slightly rushed throughout the beginning of the meal. Otherwise, the price was very good for the amount of food that we got. The restaurant is out of the way from most hotels, but it's easily accessible from the cable car on California street and just a short walk from the stop.

This is a very busy very loud place! It's actually quite well planned out as there are several foods that come with the prime rib You just choose your cut of meat and you get all the sides. Seems to be a fair price for what you get. It was a fun evening and fairly priced.

column3: A wait, delicious food and no lingering
column4: Either call ahead or be prepared for about 45-60 min wait. The food is delicious with huge portions and moderately priced. If you enjoy a lovely grilled piece of prime rib... Stop! Look no further... It's here.

Typically not a fan of such restaurants as I find their meat pretty bland. However, they offer the Kings Sear, which they seat both sides of the prime rib, marinated with salt and pepper.  The taste is pretty incredible and you don't have to pay an arm and a leg for it.  Definitely a must go to joint in SF

column3: I will dream about this dinner for a long time...
column4: I can tell you that you will unequivocally never, ever, have a better slice of prime rib (FYI- don't be afraid to order "rare"). Everything about this spectacularly hedonistic experience was superb. The service and ambiance is classic and excellent. However, the star, by far is the food. From the meat, to the generously portioned sides, to the desserts, everything was delicious. I was so pleasantly surprised at how good everything was. Even with the huge portions, I was enjoying everything so much that I finished everything. I hope to return MANY times in the future!
This was the high light of my San Fran eating experience. The meat selection is outstanding, and the quality is superb. I highly recommend treating yourself to this spot.
Excellent food, reasonable price! You can get any cut of prime rib from a petite cut to the King Henry cut with bone. Salad, bake potato and side dish is included. Excellent value!
texas size food over here! great experience, wonderful food, large servings. its pricey but worth it!
The steaks are juicy and tender, and amazingly we can ask for more for free! The only drawback is it is too crowded at times.

This place has a limited menu and focusses on, as the name suggests, prime rib. But boy do they do it well. The beef is cooked as requested and is very tender and tasty. Really enjoyed the meal and it is decent value too.
Love it. Start with a gin martini and salad. Don't fill up on the bread. Get the King cut, baked potato, creamed spinach, and a big cabernet. Go with a date or a big group, it works for any occasion.

I have been to this restaurant a few times and the food and service has always been consitently good. This is not mind blowingly good but its definitely great food when you're feeling carnivorous in San Francisco.
Slip the ma√Ætre d a few bucks to get a seat if you aren't on the list. Food was delicious, service was excellent - one of my favorites in San Fran.
very very loud place , i wont go there for a date food was very very average , the steak are looking awesome but taste not too good
Get ear plugs with you . You'll need that. The acoustic of ambience is very bad. You can hear all noise around your table!!!

We were extremely satisfied with our visit here. Service matched up to the quality of the food. Portions were big for us but it was so nice we finished the lot and worried about the over indulgence after! Highly recommend to anybody, for any occasion.
Big, Delicious and succulent Prime Rib, the salad and the bread were good too and the ambiance was enjoyable.
This place is a must for meat lovers coming through SF. Its great. I promise. Went here for dinner with friends, and we all left stuffed and satisfied. Also, the lemon drop drink is delicious.
I've had good prime rib before but nothing compared to this one. Everything was perfect, including the cheesecake I had for dessert. Yes, it's rather pricey, but unforgettable.

column3: Could not eat the whole thing
column4: A great old steakhouse not in the Midwest. Best prime rib ever..if you love prime rib this is the place to go. Went with my daughter , her boyfriend and hubby. Had great food and service. Will go back again.
The name says it all. Prime rib to die for. I eat here all the time and will continue to do so as long as they have the best prime rib.
Best prime rib eve! Great salad as well! If you love prime rib there is none better then the House of Prime Rib. Tough to get a reservation, but they do take walking, but go early and enjoy!
in.you.go..heres.your.meat.thanks..get.out...realy..just.a.factory.good.meat..nothing.to.scream.on..just.a.factory
Long established and still standing for good reason! It truly has the best prime rib and excellent service. You will need to reserve about a month in advance.
It's a tradition of mine to come here every December with friends. The food is fantastic, service is great, and the atmosphere is warm and spirited. We will be back next year.
The House of Prime Rib is a long time staple of San Francisco. Their steaks are excellent. You will not be disappointed.
Couldn't wait to take our friends here, and the HOPR did not disappoint. Our 3rd time here and expectations were once again exceeded. They are the most consistent restaurant ever.

column3: When you only do ONE thing you better do it Right ~ this place does it!
column4: You must get a reservation to eat here. If you have someone in your group who does not eat Beef ~ they can order a Veggie plate. One of the best Prime Rib dinners I have had.
Well the food was okay, but a very special type of preperation of the meat. But great place and a experince.
I went there after a long time. It was good as always. Some things never change. I reccomend it with no hesitation.
My husband and I ate here during our first visit to San Francisco in celebration of our anniversary. The food and service were excellent. I recommend splurging on this restaurant at least once.

The BEST prime rib!!! temperature was perfect. you did not need a knife to cut through the tender steak. we went for a birthday celebration dinner and everyone was very helpful to make it a memorable experience.

column3: A perfect place for Dad's birthday
column4: Went there for a special occasion with the entire family and had a wonderful time. The prime rib is delicious, the sides are very good and the cocktails are the best!

Could not believe the quality of food with such a moderate price! Order the spinach in garlic and oil instead of the creamed spinach!! Amazing!! Service, quality and quantity. They truly outdid themselves. Great bar, too.

column3: The Best Prime Rib in the West
column4: A definite must go for hardcore prime rib connoisseurs. Zeppelin transported and cut to perfection in plate of au jus than never runs out. Advance reservations is a must if you want to eat at a decent time due to its popularity.

column3: still one of the best prime ribs to be had.
column4: Came in on a early dinner at 5:30, hard to reserve, but worth it, the ribs was perfect. and today i got a peice with a large cab on it. envirment was engergetic and the prime ribs is just so nice!
This restaurant serves one thing and does it right. You must love prime rib but it could be the best prime rib you have ever had! Service is excellent. Loved everything from start to finish.

column3: Don't miss.....worth a trip...just to eat here
column4: From the initial contact with the truly professional waiters, to the sequenced progression of the house speciality.....everything done to true perfection. Having eaten all over the world this is special restaurant.

Atmosphere, food, and wait staff are all top notch! Prime rib was incredible. Bread, salad, spinach and bake potato delicious! Waiter was very knowledgeable and presentation of food was terrific. Yorkshire pudding that came with the meal was also delicious!! Highly recommend.
Anthony Bourdain was right. House of Prime Rib is the best. Retro sans kitsch environment. Best quality meat you could hope for. They do one thing and they do it right. Sides are fabulous.
Crowded, loud, and unnecessarily spicy spinach. The meat is good, specially if you like juice on it.
The best steak ever. We ordered well done king steak for two of course and it was a lot but really really good. Of course is expensive but worth it. They don't have sangria :( I love this place :)

column3: Best Place to go for Prime Rib
column4: I have been going here for many years and it never disappoints. The Prime Rib is great. Service is great. Nothing at all to complain about
Visited my old home in SF after 40 years away. House of Prime rib was just as wonderful as the old days. Fabulous food and service.
excellent if you love prime rib. not much more to eat. Very crowded and noisey. The service was prompt and very good. Many extra's included in the price

From the well prepared (and large) cocktails, to the salad prepared table side, to the beyond-delicious prime rib, to the friendly and efficient wait staff, this place exudes excellence and tradition! A must-do when in SF.

Had a great experience here with my husband, daughter (5 at the time) and in-laws. The food was great, and service was excellent. The waitress was so good to my daughter that my daughter talked about her for the rest of the trip. Great experience!
Food was expensive but really delicious. Would have given it five stars but it was so noisy and crowded, I was practically sitting with the next table.

Prime Rib here is really great, glad I waited to eat at 10 pm. Even then it was still crowded. It was a very happy and lively atmosphere. I highly recommend calling ahead and get a reservation. A bit cramp crowded.
Just the best prime rib you will ever taste. Service is excellent too. If you are a vegetarian steer well clear, however if you like your meat melt in the mouth then book up !!
Absolutely amazing prime rib. You have a choice of 4 cuts and then baked or mashed potato. That's all you have to make for decisions and you will be satisfied. Definitely worth the price tag.

If you love Prime Rib.. then this is a must place to visit when you are in the City. It a decadent old resturant that serves a great portion of prime rib with the usual side dishes. typical of a great prime rib establishment...
We thoroughly enjoyed the preparation and flourish involved in selecting the cuts and the creation of the salad. It was the best creamed spinach ever as well.
If you're a Lawry's fan, you'll find this place fits that mold. Our meal was great, and they were very accomodating about our separate check needs.
Great Prime Rib Dinner. Its can get loud and if you dont have a reservation, the wait can be long; but, if Its meat that you want; this is the place.

This is an experience in itself. My husband and I were recommended to try this restaurant and, if you're a carnivore, it does't disappoint. Well worth a visit if you're in San Francisco. A note of warning - the serves are HUGE (for us Australians).
Very lucky that I live close by to this restaurant, spending our special occasion or just to make tummy great the best .
Perfectly cooked for varying tastes. Medium rare for US guests, medium to well for UK! Good service. Booking essential. Would be fine dining with better dress code.

column3: Fantastic food. Best prime rib I've ever had.
column4: Best prime rib I've ever had. Every side dish is wonderful too. Great staff. Old-time feel. The place is pretty noisy, but that kind of adds to the fun.
I never had prime rib until I ate at The House of Prime Rib. Thanks to them I fell in love with prime rib. Amazing.

Our expectations were high given it's ratings Service was fantastic Food whilst great quality was not for everyone but can't fault the size of helpings!! If you are looking for expansive menu then probably not for you
Step back in time here, great food, carving stations, excellent prime rib and sides. Although Yorkshire pudding is well touted, I guess its an acquired taste. Very well known and popular place!

HoPR offers amazing prime rib, great sides, and great drinks. Service is friendly, and the "all-in" pricing is a bargain. We had a 90-minute wait for a table on a Tuesday--fortunately Gina the bartender and Aaron the waiter made the time fly.
I had read the reviews and was all set for a big night at the House of Prime a Rib in San Francisco. The place was packed and we felt rushed by the waiter.
A little late with this review. Nice old restaurant with good food. The service was really good too! So much food, I think everyone had enough for lunch the next day!
